trans-unit.source: Wi-Fi connections | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Wi-Fi connections | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Use Wi-Fi profiles to help users connect to your Wi-Fi networks.
trans-unit.target: Use Wi-Fi profiles to help users connect to your Wi-Fi networks.

trans-unit.source: Configure devices to connect to your corporate Wi-Fi networks
trans-unit.target: Configure devices to connect to your corporate Wi-Fi networks

trans-unit.source: Use Microsoft Intune Wi-Fi profiles to deploy wireless network settings to users and devices in your organization.
trans-unit.target: Use Microsoft Intune Wi-Fi profiles to deploy wireless network settings to users and devices in your organization.

trans-unit.source: When you deploy a Wi-Fi profile, your users will have access to your corporate Wi-Fi without having to configure it themselves.
trans-unit.target: When you deploy a Wi-Fi profile, your users will have access to your corporate Wi-Fi without having to configure it themselves.

trans-unit.source: For example, you install a new Wi-Fi network named **Contoso Wi-Fi** and want to set up all iOS devices to connect to this network.
trans-unit.target: For example, you install a new Wi-Fi network named **Contoso Wi-Fi** and want to set up all iOS devices to connect to this network.

trans-unit.source: Here's the process:
trans-unit.target: Here's the process:

trans-unit.source: Wi-Fi profile process summary
trans-unit.target: Wi-Fi profile process summary

trans-unit.source: Create a Wi-Fi profile containing the settings necessary to connect to the **Contoso Wi-Fi** wireless network.
trans-unit.target: Create a Wi-Fi profile containing the settings necessary to connect to the **Contoso Wi-Fi** wireless network.

trans-unit.source: Deploy the profile to the group of users with iOS devices.
trans-unit.target: Deploy the profile to the group of users with iOS devices.

trans-unit.source: Users find the new **Contoso Wi-Fi** network in the list of wireless networks and can easily connect to this network.
trans-unit.target: Users find the new **Contoso Wi-Fi** network in the list of wireless networks and can easily connect to this network.

trans-unit.source: How to create a Wi-Fi profile
trans-unit.target: How to create a Wi-Fi profile

trans-unit.source: You can deploy Wi-Fi profiles to the following platforms:
trans-unit.target: You can deploy Wi-Fi profiles to the following platforms:

trans-unit.source: Android 4.0 and later
trans-unit.target: Android 4.0 and later

trans-unit.source: iOS 8.0 and later
trans-unit.target: iOS 8.0 and later

trans-unit.source: Mac OS X 10.9 and later
trans-unit.target: Mac OS X 10.9 and later

trans-unit.source: For devices that run Windows 8.1 or Windows 10 desktop or mobile, you can import a Wi-Fi configuration profile that was previously exported to a file.
trans-unit.target: For devices that run Windows 8.1 or Windows 10 desktop or mobile, you can import a Wi-Fi configuration profile that was previously exported to a file.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Export or Import a Wi-Fi configuration profile for Windows devices](#export-or-import-a-wi-fi-configuration-profile-for-windows-devices).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Export or Import a Wi-Fi configuration profile for Windows devices](#export-or-import-a-wi-fi-configuration-profile-for-windows-devices).

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), click **Policy** > **Add Policy**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), click **Policy** > **Add Policy**.

trans-unit.source: Select one of the following policy types, and then click **Create Policy**:
trans-unit.target: Select one of the following policy types, and then click **Create Policy**:

trans-unit.source: Wi-Fi Profile (Android 4 and later)
trans-unit.target: Wi-Fi Profile (Android 4 and later)

trans-unit.source: Wi-Fi Profile (iOS 8.0 and later)
trans-unit.target: Wi-Fi Profile (iOS 8.0 and later)

trans-unit.source: Wi-Fi Profile (Mac OS X 10.9 and later)
trans-unit.target: Wi-Fi Profile (Mac OS X 10.9 and later)

trans-unit.source: There are no recommended settings for this policy type.
trans-unit.target: There are no recommended settings for this policy type.

trans-unit.source: You must create a custom policy.
trans-unit.target: You must create a custom policy.

trans-unit.source: Provide the name and description for the profile.
trans-unit.target: Provide the name and description for the profile.

trans-unit.source: Specify the **Network Connections** values.
trans-unit.target: Specify the **Network Connections** values.

trans-unit.source: **SSID (Service Set Identifier)**: Users see the network name, not the SSID.
trans-unit.target: **SSID (Service Set Identifier)**: Users see the network name, not the SSID.

trans-unit.source: **Connect when the network is not broadcasting its name (SSID)**: Select this option to allow devices to connect to the network when it is not visible in the list of networks (because it is hidden and not broadcasting its name).
trans-unit.target: **Connect when the network is not broadcasting its name (SSID)**: Select this option to allow devices to connect to the network when it is not visible in the list of networks (because it is hidden and not broadcasting its name).

trans-unit.source: Configure the **Security Settings** for the selected platform.
trans-unit.target: Configure the **Security Settings** for the selected platform.

trans-unit.source: The available settings depend on the security types you select, and are described in [Security settings](#security-settings).
trans-unit.target: The available settings depend on the security types you select, and are described in [Security settings](#security-settings).

trans-unit.source: (iOS and MAC OS X only) Configure **Proxy Settings**
trans-unit.target: (iOS and MAC OS X only) Configure **Proxy Settings**

trans-unit.source: Setting name
trans-unit.target: Setting name

trans-unit.source: More information
trans-unit.target: More information

trans-unit.source: Use when:
trans-unit.target: Use when:

trans-unit.source: Proxy settings for this Wi-Fi connection
trans-unit.target: Proxy settings for this Wi-Fi connection

trans-unit.source: Choose the proxy settings type:
trans-unit.target: Choose the proxy settings type:

trans-unit.source: **None** (default)
trans-unit.target: **None** (default)

trans-unit.source: **Manual** - Manually specify the URL and port number of the proxy server.
trans-unit.target: **Manual** - Manually specify the URL and port number of the proxy server.

trans-unit.source: **Automatic** – Use a configuration file to configure the proxy server.
trans-unit.target: **Automatic** – Use a configuration file to configure the proxy server.

trans-unit.source: Always
trans-unit.target: Always

trans-unit.source: **Proxy server address** and **Port number**
trans-unit.target: **Proxy server address** and **Port number**

trans-unit.source: Specify the URL and port number of the proxy server.
trans-unit.target: Specify the URL and port number of the proxy server.

trans-unit.source: **Proxy settings for this Wi-Fi connection** is set to **Manual**
trans-unit.target: **Proxy settings for this Wi-Fi connection** is set to **Manual**

trans-unit.source: Proxy Server URL
trans-unit.target: Proxy Server URL

trans-unit.source: Specify the URL of the file containing the proxy server settings.
trans-unit.target: Specify the URL of the file containing the proxy server settings.

trans-unit.source: **Proxy settings for this Wi-Fi connection** is set to **Automatic**
trans-unit.target: **Proxy settings for this Wi-Fi connection** is set to **Automatic**

trans-unit.source: Save the Wi-Fi profile
trans-unit.target: Save the Wi-Fi profile

trans-unit.source: The new policy is displayed in the **Configuration Policies** node of the **Policy** workspace.
trans-unit.target: The new policy is displayed in the **Configuration Policies** node of the **Policy** workspace.

trans-unit.source: See **Next steps** for information about deploying the profile.
trans-unit.target: See **Next steps** for information about deploying the profile.

trans-unit.source: Export or Import a Wi-Fi configuration profile for Windows devices
trans-unit.target: Export or Import a Wi-Fi configuration profile for Windows devices

trans-unit.source: For devices that run Windows 8.1 or Windows 10 desktop or mobile, you can import a Wi-Fi configuration profile that was previously exported to a file.
trans-unit.target: For devices that run Windows 8.1 or Windows 10 desktop or mobile, you can import a Wi-Fi configuration profile that was previously exported to a file.

trans-unit.source: Export a Wi-Fi profile
trans-unit.target: Export a Wi-Fi profile

trans-unit.source: In Windows, you can use the **netsh wlan** utility to export an existing Wi-Fi profile to an XML file readable by Intune.
trans-unit.target: In Windows, you can use the **netsh wlan** utility to export an existing Wi-Fi profile to an XML file readable by Intune.

trans-unit.source: On a Windows computer that already has the required WiFi profile installed, follow this following procedure.
trans-unit.target: On a Windows computer that already has the required WiFi profile installed, follow this following procedure.

trans-unit.source: Create a local folder for the exported W-Fi- profiles, such as c:\WiFi
trans-unit.target: Create a local folder for the exported W-Fi- profiles, such as c:\WiFi

trans-unit.source: Open up a Command Prompt as an Administrator.
trans-unit.target: Open up a Command Prompt as an Administrator.

trans-unit.source: Run the command `netsh wlan show profiles`, and note the name of the profile you'd like to export.
trans-unit.target: Run the command `netsh wlan show profiles`, and note the name of the profile you'd like to export.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the profile name is *WiFiName*.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the profile name is *WiFiName*.

trans-unit.source: Run this command: `netsh wlan export profile name="ProfileName" folder=c:\Wifi`.This will create a Wi-Fi profile file named “Wi-Fi-WiFiName.xml in your target folder ”.
trans-unit.target: Run this command: `netsh wlan export profile name="ProfileName" folder=c:\Wifi`.This will create a Wi-Fi profile file named “Wi-Fi-WiFiName.xml in your target folder ”.

trans-unit.source: Import a Wi-Fi profile
trans-unit.target: Import a Wi-Fi profile

trans-unit.source: Use the **Windows Wi-Fi Import Policy** to import a set of Wi-Fi settings that you can then deploy to the required user or device groups.
trans-unit.target: Use the **Windows Wi-Fi Import Policy** to import a set of Wi-Fi settings that you can then deploy to the required user or device groups.

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), click **Policy** > **Add Policy**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), click **Policy** > **Add Policy**.

trans-unit.source: Configure a policy of the type **Windows** > **Wi-Fi Import (Windows 8.1 and later)**.
trans-unit.target: Configure a policy of the type **Windows** > **Wi-Fi Import (Windows 8.1 and later)**.

trans-unit.source: This policy can be applied to Windows 8.1 and Windows 10 desktop and mobile devices.
trans-unit.target: This policy can be applied to Windows 8.1 and Windows 10 desktop and mobile devices.

trans-unit.source: You can only create and deploy a *custom* Windows Wi-Fi import policy.
trans-unit.target: You can only create and deploy a *custom* Windows Wi-Fi import policy.

trans-unit.source: Recommended settings are not available.
trans-unit.target: Recommended settings are not available.

trans-unit.source: Specify the following general values for the Windows Wi-Fi Import Policy:
trans-unit.target: Specify the following general values for the Windows Wi-Fi Import Policy:

trans-unit.source: Setting name
trans-unit.target: Setting name

trans-unit.source: More information
trans-unit.target: More information

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Enter a unique name for the Wi-Fi profile to identify it in the Intune console.
trans-unit.target: Enter a unique name for the Wi-Fi profile to identify it in the Intune console.

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Provide a description w of the Wi-Fi profile and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.
trans-unit.target: Provide a description w of the Wi-Fi profile and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.

trans-unit.source: Specify the following values under the **Custom Wi-Fi Profile** heading:
trans-unit.target: Specify the following values under the **Custom Wi-Fi Profile** heading:

trans-unit.source: Setting name
trans-unit.target: Setting name

trans-unit.source: More information
trans-unit.target: More information

trans-unit.source: Configuration profile file
trans-unit.target: Configuration profile file

trans-unit.source: Click **Import** to select the XML file containing the Wi-Fi profile settings that you want to import into Intune.
trans-unit.target: Click **Import** to select the XML file containing the Wi-Fi profile settings that you want to import into Intune.

trans-unit.source: Custom configuration profile name (displayed to users)
trans-unit.target: Custom configuration profile name (displayed to users)

trans-unit.source: Displays the name of the Wi-Fi configuration profile as it will be shown to users on their device.
trans-unit.target: Displays the name of the Wi-Fi configuration profile as it will be shown to users on their device.

trans-unit.source: Configuration profile details
trans-unit.target: Configuration profile details

trans-unit.source: Displays the XML code for the configuration profile you selected.
trans-unit.target: Displays the XML code for the configuration profile you selected.

trans-unit.source: When you are finished, click **Save Policy**.
trans-unit.target: When you are finished, click **Save Policy**.

trans-unit.source: The new policy displays in the **Configuration Policies** node of the **Policy** workspace.
trans-unit.target: The new policy displays in the **Configuration Policies** node of the **Policy** workspace.

trans-unit.source: Deploy the profile
trans-unit.target: Deploy the profile

trans-unit.source: A profile is a type of policy, so use the Policy workspace to deploy it.
trans-unit.target: A profile is a type of policy, so use the Policy workspace to deploy it.

trans-unit.source: In the **Policy** workspace, select the policy you want to deploy, then click **Manage Deployment**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Policy** workspace, select the policy you want to deploy, then click **Manage Deployment**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Manage Deployment** dialog box:
trans-unit.target: In the **Manage Deployment** dialog box:

trans-unit.source: **To deploy the policy** - Select one or more groups to which you want to deploy the policy, then click **Add** > **OK**.
trans-unit.target: **To deploy the policy** - Select one or more groups to which you want to deploy the policy, then click **Add** > **OK**.

trans-unit.source: **To close the dialog box without deploying it** - Click **Cancel**.
trans-unit.target: **To close the dialog box without deploying it** - Click **Cancel**.

trans-unit.source: A status summary and alerts on the **Overview** page of the **Policy** workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.
trans-unit.target: A status summary and alerts on the **Overview** page of the **Policy** workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.

trans-unit.source: Security settings
trans-unit.target: Security settings

trans-unit.source: These tables have the details for the security settings that are available for Android, iOS, and Mac OS X Wi-Fi profiles.
trans-unit.target: These tables have the details for the security settings that are available for Android, iOS, and Mac OS X Wi-Fi profiles.

trans-unit.source: Security settings for Android devices
trans-unit.target: Security settings for Android devices

trans-unit.source: Setting name
trans-unit.target: Setting name

trans-unit.source: More information
trans-unit.target: More information

trans-unit.source: Use when:
trans-unit.target: Use when:

trans-unit.source: Security type
trans-unit.target: Security type

trans-unit.source: Select the security protocol for the wireless network:
trans-unit.target: Select the security protocol for the wireless network:

trans-unit.source: WPA-Enterprise/WPA2-Enterprise
trans-unit.target: WPA-Enterprise/WPA2-Enterprise

trans-unit.source: **No authentication (Open)** if the network is unsecured.
trans-unit.target: **No authentication (Open)** if the network is unsecured.

trans-unit.source: Always
trans-unit.target: Always

trans-unit.source: EAP Type
trans-unit.target: EAP Type

trans-unit.source: Choose the Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) type used to authenticate secured wireless connections:
trans-unit.target: Choose the Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) type used to authenticate secured wireless connections:

trans-unit.source: EAP-TLS
trans-unit.target: EAP-TLS

trans-unit.source: PEAP
trans-unit.target: PEAP

trans-unit.source: EAP-TTLS
trans-unit.target: EAP-TTLS

trans-unit.source: You selected the **WPA-Enterprise/WPA2-Enterprise** security type.
trans-unit.target: You selected the **WPA-Enterprise/WPA2-Enterprise** security type.

trans-unit.source: Select root certificates for server validation
trans-unit.target: Select root certificates for server validation

trans-unit.source: Click **Select**, then choose the trusted root certificate profile used to authenticate the connection.
trans-unit.target: Click **Select**, then choose the trusted root certificate profile used to authenticate the connection.

trans-unit.source: **Important:** To create the trusted root certificate profile, see [Secure resource access with certificate profiles](secure-resource-access-with-certificate-profiles.md).
trans-unit.target: **Important:** To create the trusted root certificate profile, see [Secure resource access with certificate profiles](secure-resource-access-with-certificate-profiles.md).

trans-unit.source: Any **EAP Type** is selected.
trans-unit.target: Any **EAP Type** is selected.

trans-unit.source: Authentication method
trans-unit.target: Authentication method

trans-unit.source: Select the authentication method for the connection:
trans-unit.target: Select the authentication method for the connection:

trans-unit.source: **Certificates** to specify the client certificate
trans-unit.target: **Certificates** to specify the client certificate

trans-unit.source: **Username and Password** to specify a different method for authentication
trans-unit.target: **Username and Password** to specify a different method for authentication

trans-unit.source: The **EAP type** is **PEAP** or **EAP-TTLS**.
trans-unit.target: The **EAP type** is **PEAP** or **EAP-TTLS**.

trans-unit.source: Select a non-EAP method for authentication (Inner identity)
trans-unit.target: Select a non-EAP method for authentication (Inner identity)

trans-unit.source: Select how you will authenticate the connection:
trans-unit.target: Select how you will authenticate the connection:

trans-unit.source: None
trans-unit.target: None

trans-unit.source: Unencrypted password (PAP)
trans-unit.target: Unencrypted password (PAP)

trans-unit.source: Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP)
trans-unit.target: Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP)

trans-unit.source: Microsoft CHAP (MS-CHAP)
trans-unit.target: Microsoft CHAP (MS-CHAP)

trans-unit.source: Microsoft CHAP Version 2 (MS-CHAP v2)
trans-unit.target: Microsoft CHAP Version 2 (MS-CHAP v2)

trans-unit.source: The available options depend on the EAP type you selected.
trans-unit.target: The available options depend on the EAP type you selected.

trans-unit.source: The **Authentication method** is **Username and Password**.
trans-unit.target: The **Authentication method** is **Username and Password**.

trans-unit.source: Enable identity privacy (Outer Identity)
trans-unit.target: Enable identity privacy (Outer Identity)

trans-unit.source: Specify the text sent in response to an EAP identity request.
trans-unit.target: Specify the text sent in response to an EAP identity request.

trans-unit.source: This text can be any value.
trans-unit.target: This text can be any value.

trans-unit.source: During authentication, this anonymous identity is initially sent, and then followed by the real identification sent in a secure tunnel.
trans-unit.target: During authentication, this anonymous identity is initially sent, and then followed by the real identification sent in a secure tunnel.

trans-unit.source: The **EAP type** is **PEAP** or **EAP-TTLS**.
trans-unit.target: The **EAP type** is **PEAP** or **EAP-TTLS**.

trans-unit.source: Select a client certificate for client authentication (Identity Certificate)
trans-unit.target: Select a client certificate for client authentication (Identity Certificate)

trans-unit.source: Click **Select**, then choose the SCEP certificate profile used to authenticate the connection.
trans-unit.target: Click **Select**, then choose the SCEP certificate profile used to authenticate the connection.

trans-unit.source: **Important:** To create a SCEP certificate profile, see [Secure resource access with certificate profiles](secure-resource-access-with-certificate-profiles.md).
trans-unit.target: **Important:** To create a SCEP certificate profile, see [Secure resource access with certificate profiles](secure-resource-access-with-certificate-profiles.md).

trans-unit.source: The security type is **WPA-Enterprise/WPA2-Enterprise**, and any **EAP type** is selected.
trans-unit.target: The security type is **WPA-Enterprise/WPA2-Enterprise**, and any **EAP type** is selected.

trans-unit.source: Use Protected Access Credential (PAC)
trans-unit.target: Use Protected Access Credential (PAC)

trans-unit.source: Select to use protected access credentials to establish an authenticated tunnel between the client and the authentication server.
trans-unit.target: Select to use protected access credentials to establish an authenticated tunnel between the client and the authentication server.

trans-unit.target: Provision PAC

trans-unit.source: Provisions the PAC file to your devices.
trans-unit.target: Provisions the PAC file to your devices.

trans-unit.source: When used, you can also select **Provision PAC Anonymously** to ensure that the PAC file is provisioned without authenticating the server.
trans-unit.target: When used, you can also select **Provision PAC Anonymously** to ensure that the PAC file is provisioned without authenticating the server.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create a Wi-Fi profile with a pre-shared key in [Pre-shared key Wi-Fi profile](pre-shared-key-wi-fi-profile.md)
